stripComment

protected static java.lang.String stripComment(java.lang.String str)

getServByName

public IPServEnt getServByName(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String proto)
Returns the entry associated to the service name and protocol in argument.

Parameters:
name - the name or alias of the service.
proto - the name of the protocol (udp/tcp). If null, the first entry matching the service name is returned.
Returns:
An IPServEnt entry describing the service. Returns null if there is no service matching this name and this protocol.

getServByPort

public IPServEnt getServByPort(int port,
                               java.lang.String proto)
Returns the entry associated to the service port and protocol in argument.

Parameters:
port - the port number of the service.
proto - the name of the protocol (udp/tcp)
Returns:
An IPServEnt entry describing the service. Returns null if there is no service matching this port number and this protocol.

readServices

public void readServices(java.io.InputStream input)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Reads services definition from a stream. The format is the one used by /etc/services in FreeBSD. From services(5):
For each service a single line should be present with the following information:
  • official service name
  • port number
  • protocol name
  • aliases
Items are separated by any number of blanks and/or tab characters. The port number and protocol name are considered a single item; a ``/'' is used to separate the port and protocol (e.g. ``512/tcp''). A ``#'' indi- cates the beginning of a comment; subsequent characters up to the end of the line are not interpreted by the routines which search the file.
Service names may contain any printable character other than a field delimiter, newline, or comment character.

Parameters:
input - the stream to read.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

serviceLookup

public int serviceLookup(java.lang.String service,
                         java.lang.String protocol)
Converts the service in argument to a port number. If service is an integer, return this integer. Otherwise, search the service using the services database.

Parameters:
service - service name to lookup.
protocol - protocol used by the service (udp or tcp).
Returns:
the port number associated to the service or -1 if the service is not in the services database.
